backend/main.mo: Motoko actor defining an application form submission system with types for career status, program, and form data, supporting submit, get, and getAll operations backed by an in-memory map.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report mapping three implemented features—/terms route, TermsOfUsePage component, and footer Terms of Use link—to their respective source files and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Auto-generated JSON document providing one-sentence summaries of each frontend source file for build planning reference.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS entry point defining OKLCH-based CSS custom properties for light and dark color themes including background, foreground, chart, and sidebar tokens.
frontend/index.html: HTML shell with viewport meta tag, title set to 'AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator', and a root div that mounts the React app via main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: TanStack Router configuration defining all application routes (home, infrastructure, data-analytics, qa-testing, apply, success, about, terms) under a shared Layout root route.
frontend/src/components/CareerDemandSect: Marketing section displaying US/Canada AI infrastructure salary ranges ($95K–$180K), a career growth image, and a no-coding-required callout card.
frontend/src/components/CareerServicesSe: Section listing six included career services (resume review, mock interviews, job strategy, LinkedIn, negotiation, growth planning) with icons and a value statement.
frontend/src/components/CompaniesLogoSec: Section displaying a grid of six company names (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Deloitte, Accenture, IBM) with placeholder icons representing companies where graduates have interviewed.
frontend/src/components/CurriculumSectio: Four-phase 8-month curriculum section rendered as cards covering Tech Foundations, Cloud Engineering, Kubernetes, and AI+Cloud Integration with topics and durations.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsCar: Renders a 'Career Accelerator Layer' section displaying six career support services (resume rewriting, LinkedIn optimization, SQL prep, etc.) as icon cards.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsCur: Displays the five-phase program curriculum (SQL, Python, Data Engineering, AI Integration, BI/Visualization) as cards with topics and outcomes for each phase.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsFAQ: Renders an accordion-based FAQ section with six common questions and answers about the Data Analytics program.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsFin: Final call-to-action section urging visitors to apply for the next cohort, with a link to the /apply route and a note about limited seats.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsHer: Hero section for the AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator program, displaying the program title, value proposition, key skill icons, and an apply CTA button.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsOpp: Highlights the market opportunity by listing required skills, showing average US salary ranges for data roles, and noting that AI amplifies skilled data professionals.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsPri: Justifies the $2,999 program price by contrasting what the program is not (self-paced videos, random tutorials) versus what it includes (live mentorship, projects, career support).
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsPro: Displays the program format details (8-month duration, live sessions, labs, portfolio projects, cohort size, etc.) as icon cards with a note about selective admission.
Showcases five portfolio projects students will build (sales dashboard, marketing analytics, data pipeline, AI reporting tool, business presentation) as cards with descriptions.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsTar: Identifies the target audience for the program (business graduates, MBAs, finance/marketing professionals, career switchers, etc.) and emphasizes no math or coding prerequisites are required.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsWhy: Renders a section explaining why the Data Analytics program exists by displaying a grid of common problems with most data courses, each shown with an X icon.
frontend/src/components/DifferentiationS: Displays a section contrasting what the program is NOT (bootcamp, generic IT training, self-paced videos) with what it IS, using cards with X and Check icons.
frontend/src/components/FAQSection.tsx: Renders an accordion-based FAQ section with seven questions covering prerequisites, time commitment, job outcomes, payment plans, and program differences.
frontend/src/components/FeaturedPrograms: Displays three featured program cards (Infrastructure, Data Analytics, QA Automation) with badges, descriptions, and links to their respective detail pages.
A final call-to-action section with an 'Apply Now' link and 'Schedule a Call' button, urging users to start their $100K+ career before seats fill up.
frontend/src/components/FutureProofSecti: Highlights why infrastructure engineers are AI-proof by listing tasks AI cannot perform and emphasizing strategic thinking, problem-solving, and collaboration skills.
frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx: Hero section for the infrastructure program page featuring a headline, five core skill icons, and Apply/Download Curriculum CTA buttons over a background image.
frontend/src/components/HomeFAQSection.t: A compact accordion FAQ section for the home page covering beginner-friendliness, job placement, cohort language/timezone, and differentiation from low-cost courses.
Home page hero section with a headline targeting career switchers, a program summary, key stats (8 months, live cohorts, etc.), and Apply/Brochure CTA buttons.
frontend/src/components/HowItWorksSectio: Outlines the three-step program process (Apply, Learn & Build, Launch) with icons and descriptions, followed by Apply and Schedule a Call CTA buttons.
frontend/src/components/ImpactCountersSe: Displays a section with four key impact metrics (students enrolled, projects built, 1:1 hours, interview-ready grads) in a responsive grid layout.
frontend/src/components/InstructorSectio: Renders an instructor profile section highlighting certifications, real-world experience, and track record using icon cards alongside a photo.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Defines the main app layout with a sticky header (nav with program dropdown, sign in/up), a newsletter signup footer, and an Outlet for child routes.
frontend/src/components/LeadCaptureSecti: Provides a lead capture form card collecting name, email, phone, and preferred call time, with a success confirmation state after submission.
frontend/src/components/PortfolioProject: Shows a grid of four portfolio projects students will complete, each with an image, title, description, and a GitHub link indicator.
frontend/src/components/PricingSection.t: Displays a single $2,999 pricing card listing all included features, an ROI callout, and a link button to the application page.
frontend/src/components/ProgramStructure: Presents six program structure features (duration, cohort model, seat limits, mentorship, recordings, community) as icon cards plus a phase diagram image.
Lists five real-world infrastructure projects students build (cloud architecture, data pipeline, AI deployment, Kubernetes, CI/CD) with icons and two showcase images.
frontend/src/components/QACareerServices: Renders a 'Career Accelerator Layer' section displaying six career services (resume writing, LinkedIn optimization, interview prep, mock interviews, behavioral training, and a 60-day job plan) as a grid of icon cards.
frontend/src/components/QACurriculumSect: Defines and renders a detailed 3-month curriculum for the QA Automation program, organized by month and week with topics, AI labs, and projects displayed as styled cards.
frontend/src/components/QAFAQSection.tsx: Renders an accordion-based FAQ section with five questions covering beginner accessibility, automation coverage, AI role, hiring outcomes, and program differentiation.
frontend/src/components/QAFinalCTASectio: Displays a final call-to-action section urging users to apply for the next cohort, with a headline, supporting copy, and a link button to the apply page.
frontend/src/components/QAHeroSection.ts: Renders the hero section for the QA program page with a headline, program badge, AI-threat framing callout, five key skill highlights, and a cohort application button.
frontend/src/components/QAOpportunitySec: Displays a 'Why AI-Augmented QA?' section contrasting what AI can already automate versus what the program teaches, plus US salary range cards for QA roles.
frontend/src/components/QAOutcomesSectio: Renders a 'Program Outcomes' section listing seven skills graduates will have, displayed as a two-column grid of icon-and-text cards.
frontend/src/components/QAPricingSection: Displays the program pricing ($1,999) with a two-column comparison of what the program is not versus what it is, and a link button to apply.
frontend/src/components/QAProgramStructu: Renders the program format details (duration, live sessions, projects, time commitment, cohort model, post-program support) as icon cards, with a note emphasizing active learning.
frontend/src/components/QAProjectsSectio: Renders a section displaying six QA program portfolio deliverables (GitHub framework, API tests, CI pipeline, docs, AI workflow, capstone) as cards with icons, plus a closing callout about graduating with a real GitHub portfolio.
frontend/src/components/QATargetAudience: Displays a grid of seven target audience personas for the QA program using icon cards, followed by a highlighted callout emphasizing the program is focused and practical.
frontend/src/components/TargetAudienceSe: Shows a 'Who This Program Is For' section with six audience types as checkmark cards and a bottom banner noting no prior coding experience is required.
frontend/src/components/TestimonialsSect: Renders three student testimonial cards with quotes, avatar images, names, and roles in a responsive three-column grid.
Displays three core program features (cohort learning, career accelerator, AI curriculum) as icon-centered columns with a trust tagline below.
frontend/src/components/WhyStackTeacherS: Lists five differentiators for Stack Teacher (portfolio projects, mentor cohorts, interview training, AI-native curriculum, placement coaching) as bordered cards with check icons.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor (authenticated or anonymous) using React Query, and invalidates dependent queries whenever the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useApplicationForm.ts: Custom hook that exposes a `submitApplication` mutation function wrapping the backend actor's `submitApplication` call, with loading and error state, invalidating the applications query on success.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an `InternetIdentityProvider` context and `useInternetIdentity` hook for managing DFINITY Internet Identity authentication, including login, logout, and identity persistence across page reloads.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Exports two React Query hooks—`useGetAllApplications` and `useGetApplication`—that fetch application data from the ICP backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines global Tailwind CSS base styles and a full set of CSS custom properties for light and dark themes using OKLCH color values.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped in `QueryClientProvider` and `InternetIdentityProvider`.
frontend/src/pages/AboutPage.tsx: Renders the About page for Stack Teacher, describing the platform's mission, service offerings, target audiences, AI-era capabilities, and career services using icon-driven cards and sections.
frontend/src/pages/ApplicationForm.tsx: Provides a multi-field application form for users to apply to a Stack Teacher program, handling form state, validation, submission via a custom hook, and navigation to a success page on completion.
frontend/src/pages/ApplicationSuccess.ts: Displays a confirmation page after a successful program application, outlining the next steps (review, interview, decision) and linking back to the home page.
frontend/src/pages/DataAnalyticsLandingP: Composes the AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator landing page by assembling all relevant section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Composes the main home page by assembling hero, features, programs, testimonials, FAQ, and other section components in sequence.
frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx: Composes the AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator landing page by assembling all relevant section components in order.
Composes the AI-Augmented QA Automation Engineer Program landing page by assembling all relevant QA-specific section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/TermsOfUsePage.tsx: Renders the full Terms of Service page with sections covering usage terms, confidentiality, use license, and other legal provisions.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind CSS with custom design tokens including CSS-variable-based colors, display/mono font families, extended font sizes, border radii, box shadows, and accordion animations, plus the animate and typography plugins.
project_state.json: Tracks the Stack Teacher website project state, including three existing features (Terms route, TermsOfUsePage component, footer link) and one pending feature request to add a 'Terms of Use' footer link with a full 14-section Terms of Service page.
